member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Audit.AuditClient.CreateLoginAuditReport(Egnyte.Api.Audit.AuditReportFormat,System.DateTime,System.DateTime,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String},System.Collections.Generic.List{Egnyte.Api.Audit.AuditReportAccessPoint},System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String})
member.summary: Creates login audit report
member.param: Required. Determines format of audit report data
Required. Start of date range for report
Required. End of date range for report
Required. List of events to report on. At least one event must be specified
Optional. List of Egnyte access points covered by report. If not specified or empty then report will cover all access points
Optional. List of usernames to report on. If not specified or empty then report will cover all users

member.summary: Status code of response from Egnyte API

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpClient,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.String)
member.param: OAuth 2.0 token obtained from Egnyte
Domain on which you connect to egnyte, i.e.: domain is 'mydomain', when url looks like: mydomain.egnyte.com
You can provide your own httpClient. Optional
You can provide timeout for calling Egnyte API, by default it's 10 minutes. This parameter is optional
Full host name on which you connect to egnyte, i.e.: host is 'my.custom.host.com', when url looks like: my.custom.host.com

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Files
member.summary: Files allows you to perform the normal file system actions: create, update, move, copy, delete, download, and list information about files and folders

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Users
member.summary: Users allows you to create, update, get information about, and delete users. You can customize settings like user role or authentication type and even control whether a new user receives an invitation email

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Links
member.summary: Links allows you to list the file and folder links in your domain, show the details of an individual link, create new links, and delete links

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Groups
member.summary: Groups allows you to list the groups in your domain, show the details of an individual group, manage group membership, create new groups, rename groups, and delete groups. This API is designed to comply with SCIM 1.1

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Permissions
member.summary: With Permissions you can list, set, and remove folder permissions for users and groups. Refer to the table here: https://developers.egnyte.com/docs/read/Egnyte_Permissions_API#Permissions for details on our different permission levels

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Search
member.summary: The Search API allows you to find content stored in Egnyte based on filenames, metadata, and text content. Searches are performed in the context of the user token being passed. Accordingly, a user will only see results for contents they have permission to access. Note, this endpoint is currently limited to searching for files only

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClient.Audit
member.summary: The Audit Reporting API allows you to programmatically generate and retrieve reports on login activity, file actions, and permission changes. The scope of these reports effectively gives you a 360° view of the activity in your account

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.EgnyteClientHelper.GetTokenFromCode(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Uri,System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpClient)
member.summary: Send request to exchange the code for a token
member.param: This is the user's Egnyte domain. An example domain name is "acme". Note that initially your API key will only work with the single Egnyte domain you told us you would use for testing. When we approve your completed app, we will issue you a new key that works with any Egnyte domain
This is the API key that was provided to you when you registered your application

This is the secret key that was provided with your key to you when you registered your application. If your application key was requested prior to January 2015, please register for a new key to get one with a client secret

This is the URL that we will redirect to after the user has allowed or denied your request to access their account. This must be an HTTPS URL and must match the callback URL configured for your key. E.g. "https://yourapp.com/oauth"
The authorization code received from the authorization server after allowing application to use Egnyte account
Http client for sending the request

The range of bytes to download, use of this header is optional

If false, then do not include contents of folder in response
If true, then show allowed_file_link_types, allowed_folder_link_types fields, and allow_upload_links fields

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Files.FilesClient.ChunkedUploadFirstChunk(System.String,System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: The chunked upload flow provides a mechanism to upload large files—we recommend only using this flow for files larger than 100 MB. To upload files of smaller sizes, you can use the CreateOrUpdateFile method
member.param: Full path to file
Stream with the file content

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Files.FilesClient.ChunkedUploadNextChunk(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: Method for uploading second and consecutive chunks of file. To upload first chunk use ChunkedUploadFirstChunk
member.param: Full path to file
Chunk number. First should be 1, others 2, 3, etc.
Chunk upload id from response after uploading first chunk
Stream with part of file content

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Files.FilesClient.ChunkedUploadLastChunk(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.IO.MemoryStream)
member.summary: Method for uploading last chunk of file. To upload previous chunks use ChunkedUploadFirstChunk or ChunkedUploadNextChunk
member.param: Full path to file
Chunk number. First should be 1, others 2, 3, etc.
Chunk upload id from response after uploading first chunk
Stream with part of file content

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Files.FilesClient.UpdateFolder(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{Egnyte.Api.Files.PublicLinksType},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Uses Folder Options API to modify folder options
member.param: Full path to folder
Text description of the folder. Maximum 200 characters
Choose to allow public links from this folder for files and folders, files only, or not to allow public links.
Restricts move and delete operations to only Admins and Owners if true. This can be applied to /Shared and /Private top-level folders.
JSON object with boolean keys that can modify periodic emails about file changes.
Choose whether links can be shared to files or sub-folders within this folder.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinkDetails.Protection

member.summary: An array of valid email addresses to which the link was sent.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinkDetails.Id
member.summary: The id of the link

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinkDetailsV2.ResourceId
member.summary: Id of the associated resource, either group id if it is a file link, or the folder id if it is a folder or upload link

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinkDetailsV2.ExpiryClicks
member.summary: Number of clicks left on the link before expiration. This field is only shown if the link is to expire via clicks

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinkDetailsV2.ExpiryDate
member.summary: Date and time of the expiration of the link. This field is only shown if the link is to expire by date

member.summary: Lists all links. Please note, that if the user executing this method is not an admin, then only links created by the user will be listed
member.param: Optional. List links to a file or folder specified by its full path
Optional. List links created by this user
Optional. List links created before a given date
Optional. List links created after a given date
Optional. List links that are "file" or "folder"
Optional. Filter to links whose accessiblity is "anyone," "password," "domain," or "recipients"
Optional. The 0-based index of the initial record being requested
Optional. Limit number of entries per page. By default, all entries are returned

Optional. List links created by this user
Optional. List links created before a given date (ISO-8601 e.g., 2017-03-05T14:55:59+0000).
Optional. List links created after a given date (ISO-8601 e.g., 2017-03-05T14:55:59+0000).
Optional. List links that are "file" or "folder"
Optional. Filter to links whose accessiblity is "anyone," "password," "domain," or "recipients"
Optional. The 0-based index of the initial record being requested
Limit number of entries per page. By default the max count of 500 entries is returned.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinksListV2.Links
member.summary: An array containing the full json information for all links for your domain that this user can see within any specified ranges

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.LinksListV2.Count
member.summary: The number of links visible to the user in the domain that are returned

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Path
member.summary: Required. The absolute path of the target file or folder.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Type
member.summary: Required. This determines what type of link will be created.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Accessibility
member.summary: Required (except upload links). Determines who a link is accessible by.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Password
member.summary: Optional. When accesibility is set to password, then password can be provided.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.SendEmail
member.summary: Optional. If true is set, link will be sent via email by Egnyte.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Recipients
member.summary: Optional. List email addresses of recipients of the link. Only required if send_email is True.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Message
member.summary: Optional. Personal message to be sent in link email. Only applies if send_email is True.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.CopyMe
member.summary: Optional. If True is set, a copy of the link message will be sent to the link creator. Only applies if send_email is True. Defaults to False.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.Notify
member.summary: Optional. If True is set, link creator will be notified via email when link is accessed.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.LinkToCurrent
member.summary: Optional. If True is set, link will always refer to current version of file. Only applicable for file links.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.ExpiryDate
member.summary: Optional. The expiry date for the link. If expiry_date is specified, expiry_clicks cannot be set.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.ExpiryClicks
member.summary: Optional. The number of clicks the link is valid for. If expiry_clicks is specified, expiry_date cannot be set. Value must be between 1 - 10, inclusive.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Links.NewLink.FolderPerRecipient
member.summary: Optional. If True then each recipient's uploaded data will be put into a separate folder. Only applies to upload links.

member.name: F:Egnyte.Api.OAuthAuthorizationFlow.Code
member.summary: This represents OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow. The authorization code flow is most commonly used by applications that make server side requests.

member.name: F:Egnyte.Api.OAuthAuthorizationFlow.ImplicitGrant
member.summary: This represents OAuth 2.0 Implicit Grant flow. The implicit grant flow is most commonly used by applications browser applications.

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.OAuthHelper.GetAuthorizeUri(Egnyte.Api.OAuthAuthorizationFlow,System.String,System.String,System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Gets the URI used to initiate the OAuth2.0 authorization flow.
member.param: This is the OAuth 2.0 flow to authenticate your app. More information about flow can be find documentation

This is the user's Egnyte domain. An example domain name is "acme". Note that initially your API key will only work with the single Egnyte domain you told us you would use for testing. When we approve your completed app, we will issue you a new key that works with any Egnyte domain.
This is the API key that was provided to you when you registered your application.

This is the URL that we will redirect to after the user has allowed or denied your request to access their account. This must be an HTTPS URL and must match the callback URL configured for your key. E.g. "https://yourapp.com/oauth"

This is the secret key that was provided with your key to you when you registered your application. If your application key was requested prior to January 2015, please register for a new key to get one with a client secret.

Although this parameter is optional from a technical standpoint, all third party applications must scope token requests to only the endpoints they need. We will not approve applications for production use unless they properly scope their token requests or demonstrate a valid need for global scope. More details on OAuth Scopes are provided here.

As described in the OAuth 2.0 spec, this optional parameter is an opaque value used by the client to maintain state between the request and callback. The authorization server includes this value when redirecting the user-agent back to the client. The parameter can be used for preventing cross-site request forgery and passing the Egnyte domain as part of the response from the authorization server.
You may optionally set this parameter to true to have the user directed to a mobile friendly login page instead of the default page designed for a desktop browser.
member.returns: The url, where the user will be taken to an authorization page that asks them to explicitly permit your app to access their Egnyte account. This page displays information about your application taken from your profile. The user must provide their login credentials on this page to authorize your application.

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.OAuthHelper.GetAuthorizationUriResourceOwnerFlow(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the URI used to initiate the OAuth2.0 resuorce owner flow for internal applications.
member.param: This is the user's Egnyte domain. An example domain name is "acme". Note that initially your API key will only work with the single Egnyte domain you told us you would use for testing. When we approve your completed app, we will issue you a new key that works with any Egnyte domain.
This is the API key that was provided to you when you registered your application. E.g. "cba97f3apst9eqzdr5hskggx".
This is the Egnyte username of the user on whose behalf you are acting.
his is the Egnyte password of the user.

member.summary: Gets the URI used for exchanging the code for a token

This is the API key that was provided to you when you registered your application

This is the secret key that was provided with your key to you when you registered your application. If your application key was requested prior to January 2015, please register for a new key to get one with a client secret

This is the URL that we will redirect to after the user has allowed or denied your request to access their account. This must be an HTTPS URL and must match the callback URL configured for your key. E.g. "https://yourapp.com/oauth"
The authorization code received from the authorization server after allowing application to use Egnyte account
member.returns: Uri used for exchanging the code for a token

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResultItem.LastModified
member.summary: Timestamp representing the last modified date of the file.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResultItem.UploadedBy
member.summary: The formatted name of the user who uploaded the file.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResultItem.UploadedByUsername
member.summary: The username of the user who uploaded the file.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResultItem.NumberOfVersions
member.summary: The number of versions of the file available.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResultItem.SnippetHtml
member.summary: An HTML formatted snippet of the text containing the matched content.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResultItem.IsFolder
member.summary: A boolean value stating if the object is a file or folder. Please note that, currently, this API only returns file objects.

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResults.Results
member.summary: List that holds all of the matched content

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResults.TotalCount
member.summary: The total number of results matching the query

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResults.Offset
member.summary: The 0-based index of the first result in the current set of results

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Search.SearchResults.Count
member.summary: The number of results returned

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.UserName
member.summary: Required. The Egnyte username for the user. Username must start with a letter or digit. Special characters are not supported (with the exception of periods, hyphens, and underscores)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.ExternalId
member.summary: Required. This is an immutable unique identifier provided by the API consumer. Any plain text (e.g. S-1-5-21-3623811015-3361044348-30300820-1013)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.Email
member.summary: Required. The email address of the user. Any valid email address (e.g. admin@acme.com)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.FamilyName
member.summary: Required. The last name of the user. Any plain text (e.g. Smith)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.GivenName
member.summary: Required. The first name of the user. Any plain text (e.g. John)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.Active
member.summary: Required. Whether the user is active or inactive

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.AuthType
member.summary: Required. The authentication type for the user

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.UserType
member.summary: Required. The type of the user

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.Role
member.summary: Optional. The role assigned to the user. Only applicable for Power Users. Value can be 'Default' or custom role name

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.IdpUserId
member.summary: Optional. Only required if the user is SSO authenticated and not using default user mapping. Do not specify if user is not SSO authenticated. This is the way the user is identified within the SAML Response from an SSO Identity Provider, i.e. the SAML Subject (e.g. jsmith)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.UserPrincipalName
member.summary: Optional. Do not specify if user is not AD authenticated. Used to bind child authentication policies to a user when using Active Directory authentication in a multi-domain setup (e.g. jmiller@example.com)

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.Id
member.summary: An opaque, immutable, unique identifier for the user, generated by Egnyte. This identifier is used to refer to the user in all API calls

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.ExistingUser.Locked
member.summary: If user is locked

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.NewUser.SendInvite
member.summary: Required. If set to true when creating a user, an invitation email will be sent (if the user is created in active state).

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.User.UserName
member.summary: Required. The Egnyte username for the user. Username must start with a letter or digit. Special characters are not supported (with the exception of periods, hyphens, and underscores).

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.UserList.TotalResults
member.summary: Non-negative Integer. Specifies the total number of results matching the query; e.g., 1000

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.UserList.ItemsPerPage
member.summary: Non-negative Integer. Specifies the number of search results returned in a query response page; e.g., 50

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.UserList.StartIndex
member.summary: The 1-based index of the first result in the current set of search results; e.g., 1

member.name: P:Egnyte.Api.Users.UserList.Users
member.summary: Matching users

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Users.UsersClient.CreateUser(Egnyte.Api.Users.NewUser)
member.summary: Creates single user
member.param: User

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Users.UsersClient.UpdateUser(Egnyte.Api.Users.UserUpdate)
member.summary: Updates user
member.param: User with fields you want to update

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Users.UsersClient.GetUser(System.Int64)
member.summary: Retrieves a single user
member.param: An opaque, immutable, unique identifier for the user, generated by Egnyte. This identifier is used to refer to the user in all API calls

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Users.UsersClient.GetUserList(System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves all, or a chosen subset, of users
member.param: Optional. The 1-based index of the first search result. Non-negative integer that is ≥ 1
Optional. Specifies the desired maximum number of search results per page; e.g., 50. Must be a non-negative integer. The maximum count value supported is 100
Optional. Allows you to request a subset of users. Supported attributes: email, externalId, userName; e.g., Username eq "john"

member.name: M:Egnyte.Api.Users.UsersClient.DeleteUser(System.Int64)
member.summary: Deletes a single user
member.param: An opaque, immutable, unique identifier for the user, generated by Egnyte. This identifier is used to refer to the user in all API calls
